It is either indexing problem as mentioned above or you have to disable thumbnails , these are common Windows problems
I have the exact same issue and i have not found a solution yet , i think at some point you have to consider a hardware problem
Open Resource Monitor and which process is doing read / write operations

Ù„Ùˆ Ø¹Ù†Ø¯Ùƒ Skype Ø§Ø­ÙŠØ§Ù†Ø§ ÙƒØªÙŠØ± Ø¨ÙŠØ¹Ù…Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø´ÙƒÙ„Ø© Ø¯Ù‰.

Download HDTune (or any other utility) and make sure you have no bad sectors. Bad sectors lead to 100% disk usage and crippling the system because the disk recognizes it's reading the sector incorrectly and keeps retrying.

I really recommend you replace the hard drive with an SSD.
Just for kicks, the fastest desktop mechanical drive has about 120ms latency, a SATA SSD has 2ms latency, and NVMe SSD has 0.2ms
While NVMe's are awesome, they are still too expensive, but SATA SSD's are much cheaper and the return of investment on your productivity is worth it.
